course.subject: MECH
course.name: Industrial Training
course.description: A practical training course in an industrial simulated environment. For students of the Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering Department only. Graded P, PP or F.

reviews.author: Stardusty
reviews.comment_content:
1. Safety Training [Canvas Online]
     - Safety Management
     - Chemical Safety
     - Construction Safety
     - Electrical Safety
     - Fire Safety
     - Occupational Health
     - Pressure Safety
     - Radiation and Laser Safety

2. ICU328 Practical Appreciation of Electro-Mechanical Automation Systems (6 weeks) (both F2F and Online)
     - TM1503 Practical Appreciation of Electro-Mechanical Automation Systems (4 days)
     - TM1504 Practical Appreciation of Electric Vehicle Power and Driving System (4 days)
     - TM1505 Practical Appreciation of Manufacturing Processes for Electro-mechanical Products (8 days)
     - TM1506 Practical Appreciation of Automation and Control Systems (4 days)

Students may choose to attend ICU328 during Winter or Summer, but usually, most students would be attending during Summer.
F2F lessons are conducted in PolyU from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm, although instructors mostly let us leave early.
The content of this training is pretty straightforward, with some hands-on experience which is quite interesting.
However, it is very time-consuming to attend the training. Do not expect you can have a part-time job or intern when you are required to attend the training.

3. ICU320 - Appreciation of 3D CAD [SolidWorks] (5 days) (Online)

Lessons are from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm with an hour lunch break.
It would be easy to handle if you have already completed MECH2520.
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructors of ICU 320 & 328 are from the Industrial Center at PolyU.
reviews.comment_grading: This is a Pass or Fail course. It should be fine if you remember to sign in each time you arrive at the classroom. You will need to attend another session if you missed a class. If there are no sessions available after your class, you might need to attend it next year.
reviews.comment_workload:
Simple worksheets and assignments will be given during the training. Quizzes will be issued at the end of each module of ICU 328.

Students are required to submit an individual training report via PolyU blackboard within ten days after completing all ICU328 training.

Students are also required to submit a Logbook to HKUST ITC when they completed all the Industrial Training in ICU320 and ICU328 in November. It should include the following parts,
A. Table of Contents
B. Introduction of the Training Program
C. Description/Discussion on the Training Modules
D. Comments and Conclusions

reviews.author: CKL
reviews.comment_content:
1. Safety Training (2 days)
     - Chemical Safety
     - Construction Safety
2. Practical Appreciation of Electro-Mechanical        Automation Systems (4 weeks)
     - Practical Appreciation of Manufacturing Processes for Electro-mechanical Products
     - Practical Appreciation of Automation and Control Systems
     - Practical Appreciation of Electric Vehicle Power and Driving System
     - Practical Appreciation of Vehicular Systems
3. AutoCAD (1 week)

The first part is conducted in HKUST, while the second and third parts are conducted in PolyU.

This course talks about some industrial knowledge in engineering. However, it is not quite useful for being a mechanical engineer.

You can choose to attend the second and third parts in either winter or summer semester. However, most of the students cannot choose winter and have to attend the summer session.
reviews.comment_teaching: Each part will be taught by different teachers in industrial center of PolyU.
reviews.comment_grading: It is a pass or fail course. You can pass the course once you attend every lesson and fulfill the requirements. You have to attend the lesson again if you miss a lesson. Although there are quizzes in some workshops, they only check you understanding and do not count score.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to finish an assignment in each daily workshop. After you finish all workshops, you have to write a report.

reviews.author: Great Dragon
reviews.title: VERY POOR Arrangement
reviews.comment_content:
1 day of safety training
4 days of ICU320 (Appreciation of CAD)
20 days of ICU328 (Appreciation of Electro-Mechanical Automation Systems)
reviews.comment_teaching:
320 and 328 are conducted by polyu staffs
For the lecture time, mostly just reading the ppt
reviews.comment_grading: This is a pass or fail course
reviews.comment_workload:
VERY POOR Timetable arrangement. According to the industrial center website, the safety training should be conducted in year 2 winter, but it was mysteriously postponed to year 2 summer, and without any announcements. At that moment, I was wondering if I was missing something that I've realized that.

For the ICU328 module, the case was even worse. Originally it should be taken in year 2 summer. However, a sudden announcement was made when the spring final exam was half way done. The module was postponed to year 3 winter. It was too late to find any other part time jobs or internships for the summer period. Right before the year 3 winter starts, while everyone was thinking the 328 could be finished in that one month's time, one more announcement was made 1 day before the training starts. Two of the training days were changed to right before the spring term starts! For me it was reluctantly fine, but for those who planning to have other activities in the winter term, it was definitely a hell. Everything happened without any reason. I am wondering if there are adequate communications between polyu and HKUST IC. But as a student, such type of arrangement is totally unadaptable.
